column4: I upgraded from the software center thingie that pops up with updates. I upgraded from Narwhal all the way to 12.04
does sudo aplay -l    return a result?
I get two entries of HDA Intel (analog and digital)
when you open alsamixer... which is selected by default? (press f6 to see options)
It appears (- default, and 0 HDA Intel)
is this an analog connection (to speakers) and is anything muted in alsamixer?
Sorry, L3top, I don't really understand your question.
The laptop uses in-built speakers, and occasionally I plug some external speakers to it.

If I login with my regular account, I get no sound at all, and no sound device appears in volume control. If I log in with a different account (this one, which I have created precisely to deal with this), sound works OK, only that the inbuilt speakers keep sounding also when I plug the external ones.
I would like to see the output of sudo aplay -l on that other account.
Ahmmm... OK, I will try to get that, but I am afraid I won't be able to get to the terminal or copy the output (touchpad stops working in  20 seconds)
I am just curious if there is output at all... dont need it. If there is, I would expect it is the same.
The output of aplay -l is the same as in the other user, although it took it a little while to process the command

I don't know that this is a favored recommendation, but I would sudo apt-get remove pulse*; sudo apt-get install --reinstall alsa-base alsa-utils    but... that is just me. Pulse just seems to cause me all sorts of problems.
I would follow all recommendations. In fact, I have been a bit confused from the beginning with the whole Alsa and pulseaudio business. What are they, why do I need both, or do I?
In case things go wrong: would it be possible to reinstall pulse without complications?
While pulseaudio gets removed. Why do you think my touchpad stops working after 20 seconds logged in on the account with issues? Any idea?
I don't like that problem. Sounds like something might be probing it a bit too hard and it dies. Intermittent bus death is not my favorite issue.
